title: Trump Threw Another Sucker Punch, Markets in Turmoil & Bitcoin Skyrocketed
text: Donald Trump has escalated the war with China and the only question is how bad the retaliation action going to be for the US economy, the dollar index and for the global growth. There is a reason why  Bitcoin is going to move higher

title: Trump's new tariffs on China might shrink the global economy, says bank CEO
text: "It's not good for Asia's economy, it's not good for China, but it's also not good for the U.S., because ultimately, we are not able to utilize the efficiencies that each of the economies are able to offer," says OCBC's chief executive officer.

title: China warns of retaliation after Trump threatens fresh tariffs
text: China on Friday said it would not be blackmailed and warned of retaliation after U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to slap a 10% tariff on $300 billion of Chinese imports from next month, sharply escalating a trade dispute between the world's biggest economies.

title: Contrarian Says Rate Cuts May Be Too Late to Head Off a Stock Crash
text: Barry Bannister, equity strategist at Stifel Nicolaus, warns that interest rates are consistent with pre-crash levels in 1998, 2000, and 2007.

title: European stocks opened with heavy losses after Trump's China tariff plan
text: European stocks opened with heavy losses Friday after President Donald Trump said he would impose a 10% tariff on $300 billion worth of Chinese goods, starting in September.

title: China says to take countermeasures if U.S. bent on putting tariffs on Chinese goods
text: China will have to take countermeasures if the United States is bent on putting more tariffs on Chinese goods, the Chinese foreign ministry said on Friday.

title: Beijing responds to Trump's new $300 billion tariff threat
text: Trump on Thursday announced another round of tariffs on the remaining Chinese goods that had not already been targeted.

title: Dow futures slightly lower after Trump's $300 billion China tariff threat
text: U.S. stock index futures were slightly lower Friday morning, after President Donald Trump said he would slap an additional 10% tariff on Chinese imports from next month.

title: Trump is threatening France over its digital tax – these countries could be next
text: France isn't the only country pushing for a digital tax on tech giants like Amazon, Google, Apple and Facebook.

title: Millions of barrels of Iranian crude are sitting in Chinese ports — and could disrupt oil markets
text: Oil could fall by $5 to $7 a barrel if China were to draw down on these stored volumes, one expert told CNBC.

title: Analyst: Trump's new tariffs are a 'sword at the throat' of the US economy — not China's
text: Trump's latest salvo in his ongoing trade battle with Beijing is likely to hurt the American economy more than China's, analysts told CNBC.

title: Trump's tariffs jolt global stocks, spark rush to safer assets
text: Global stocks took a beating on Friday, with investors piling into safe-haven assets but oil prices recouped some losses after U.S. President Donald Trump said he would slap a 10% tariff on the remaining $300 billion of Chinese imports starting Sept.

title: Goldman: Here's China's likely next step to Trump's new trade threat
text: U.S. President Donald Trump on Thursday said Washington will apply 10% tariffs on $300 billion of Chinese goods starting Sept. 1.

title: China looks like it can hold out longer than the US in the trade war, strategist says
text: China likely hopes to wait out the U.S. election cycle, said Eric Robertsen, head of global macro strategy at Standard Chartered Bank.

title: Exclusive: Foxconn eyes sale of $8.8 billion China plant amid trade war woes - sources
text: Taiwan's Foxconn is exploring the sale of its new $8.8 billion display panel factory in China, people familiar with the matter told Reuters, as demand for the product wanes amid an intensifying U.S.-China trade war.

title: Trump's new tariffs show he's reading China all wrong, risk consultancy warns
text: President Donald Trump's threat to impose 10% tariffs on another $300 billion of Chinese goods is a serious gamble, Eurasia Group says.

title: Pompeo jabs at China's 'bad behavior,' defends US tariffs
text: "We want free and fair trade, not trade that undermines competition," U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said.

title: 'It's unclear what the end game is,' former US ambassador says of Trump's trade war with China
text: President Trump has been "wildly unpredictable" and it's not clear what the end game for the trade war is, says ex-U.S. ambassador David Adelman.

title: Trump hits China with more tariffs, sharply escalating trade dispute
text: U.S. President Donald Trump vowed to impose a 10% tariff on $300 billion of Chinese imports from Sept. 1, sharply escalating a bruising trade war between the world's largest economies and jolting financial markets.
